sentence.Network_en: Age brought a gradual diminution of his strength and energy.
sentence.Network_cn: 年龄使他的体力和精力逐渐减退.

sentence.Network_en: They hope for a small diminution in taxes.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们希望捐税能稍有减少.

这些现象统称为染色体消除(chromosome elim- ination )或染色体消减(chromosome diminution)现象,是指多倍体或混倍体组织回复到二倍体亲本之一原来的染色体数目的趋势。.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via Old French from Latin deminutio(n-), from the verb deminuere (see diminish)

entry.def: A diminution of something is its reduction in size, importance, or intensity.

example.ex: The president has accepted a diminution of the powers he originally wanted.
example.tran: 总统已经接受了对自己原本要求的权力进行削减。

example.ex: ...despite a slight diminution in asset value.
example.tran: 尽管资产价值略有减少

means.word_mean: 1. change toward something smaller or lower
2. the statement of a theme in notes of lesser duration (usually half the length of the original)
3. the act of decreasing or reducing something

auth_sentence.content: Rather, one is saddened by the diminution of sexual desire.
auth_sentence.res_content: Rather, one is saddened by the diminution of sexual desire.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Rather, one is saddened by the diminution of sexual desire.

auth_sentence.content: I bore the diminution of my riches without any outrages of sorrow.
auth_sentence.res_content: I bore the diminution of my riches without any outrages of sorrow.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I bore the diminution of my riches without any outrages of sorrow.

auth_sentence.content: But since then there has been what appears to be a steady diminution in their opinion of the company.
auth_sentence.res_content: But since then there has been what appears to be a steady diminution in their opinion of the company.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But since then there has been what appears to be a steady diminution in their opinion of the company.

sentences.en: He experienced no diminution of his physical strength.
